channel.title: Code help

item.title: Code help
item.dc:creator: @Le_Jitt Le Jitt
item.description:
@Le_Jitt wrote:

Open Client.Java then search Globalobject untill you find the portal you wish to edit or delete. Simply delete it, Save Client.Java, Compile and restart your server.

Read full topic

item.title: Code help
item.dc:creator: @Keasho Keasho
item.description:
@Keasho wrote:

[code]public void deleteObject(int objectX, int objectY)
{
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(60);
outStream.writeByte(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));
/DELETE OBJECT/
outStream.writeByte(101);
outStream.writeByteC(0);
outStream.writeByte(0);
}

public boolean inwildy = false;
public boolean inwildy2 = false;
public void checkwildy()
{
if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3672))
{
inwildy = true;
}
else
{
inwildy = true;
}
}
public void checkwildy2()
{
if ((absY <= 10112 && absY >= 3970) || (absY <= 3514))
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
else
{
inwildy2 = true;
}
}[/code]

what and where would i enter to delete an object as a portalâ€¦?
